comment: This is defiantly a 10 year old or younger ... Enjoy this release ... Almost as good as the first... Will have to try again
Tastes of coffee and chocolate ... And a lasting smokey and vanilla finish ... Ardbeg makes a tremendous product.
Nose of iodine, peat and smoke leap from the glass.  Brilliant!  Engulfs the mouth coating it in all things Islay. My new moto "the Beg to beg for".

Think sitting beside the fireplace on a cold night. Not for the faint of heart with regards to peatiness as it made my eyes water with too big of a sip. I bought a bottle because of its reputation and its darn good but not worth it's price. Don't get me wrong, it's solid, smoky, warming, full of spice and cinnamon and oaky to its core.
Cloudy gold. Something you would expect to find in a sunken pirate ship. Wet bacon and apple salad with a drizzle of petrol. Hint of pungent cocoa. Long smoky finish. This is the real deal.
Campfire smoke, candied stonefruits, vanilla, floral notes, honey, hint of cocoa.
Very peaty at the beginning. You need to let it sit and add some drops of water to fully let the flavours out

The nose reeks of that muggy forest rotten wood. Not as briny, got some meatiness to it.
Easy drinking.
Charred meat.
